meanings.definition: To clear of blame or suspicion.
meanings.sent1: After investigating further, the detective was able to deraign the suspect.
meanings.sent2: The evidence presented in court helped deraign the defendant of any wrongdoing.
meanings.sent3: The cat's innocent expression seemed to deraign it from knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: Her alibi was strong enough to deraign any doubts about her involvement.
meanings.sent5: The witness's testimony served to deraign the accused and point to the real culprit.

meanings.sent1: They needed to deraign the meeting time to accommodate everyone's schedule.
meanings.sent2: The event planner worked tirelessly to deraign all the details for the wedding.
meanings.sent3: Let's deraign a plan to ensure everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The team leader will deraign the tasks among team members.
meanings.sent5: She had to deraign her finances to save up for the trip.

meanings.sent1: The king had to deraign his kingdom wisely to ensure prosperity.
meanings.sent2: It takes skill to deraign a large organization effectively.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to deraign the rowdy class with creative activities.
meanings.sent4: She was able to deraign her time between work and family responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The coach needed to deraign the team to victory with strategic plays.
